Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little-master cup; interior: three bands around tondo; black-figure decoration consisting of upper part of winged female to right (head, arm and wing remaining; fillet or wreath in added red, faded added white flesh, part of garment in red on shoulder); exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "19" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
For the subject, compare e.g. London, British Museum GR 1867,0508.1007.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0587) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
